subSubSection.paragraph:
General diagnosis of
Austroplebeia australis
. In workers and males, frons and mesepisternum with plumose hair (
Figs 22
d, 23 c–d, 25 e), head width ≥ 1.59 mm ( Figs 10 , 14 ). In workers, HBW 0.29–0.40 mm (
Fig. 11
). Most workers have the following characteristics: thorax markings Grade 2–11 ( Figs 5 , 7 ), pronotal collar and legs with cream or yellow maculations, plumose hair on clypeus sparse (
Fig. 22
d), bristles on basitarsus III golden. In males, gonostylus gently curved, thorax markings Grades 6 and 10–13 , mesepisternum plumose hairs usually with long evenly spaced barbs and a broad triangular shape (
Fig. 25
e), HBW 0.23–0.29 mm (
Fig. 13
). In queens, short dense hair covering T 6 , but absent on T 4 –T 5 . Distribution WA , NT, QLD and NSW (
Fig. 28
c).
